h-test (Correlation, t-test...) Report

Source: R/report.htest.R
report.htest.Rd

Create a report of an h-test object.

# S3 method for htest
report(model, effsize = "cohen1988", ...)

Arguments

model

Object of class htest.
effsize

Effect size interpretation set of rules.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

See also

report

Examples

report(cor.test(iris$Sepal.Width, iris$Sepal.Length, method = "spearman"))
#> Warning: Cannot compute exact p-value with ties
#> The Spearman's rank correlation rho between iris$Sepal.Width and iris$Sepal.Length is negative, significant and small (rho = -0.17, p < .05).
report(t.test(iris$Sepal.Width, iris$Sepal.Length))
#> The Welch Two Sample t-test suggests that the difference between iris$Sepal.Width and iris$Sepal.Length (mean of x = 3.06, mean of y = 5.84, difference = -2.79) is significant (t(225.68) = -36.46, 95% CI [-2.94, -2.64], p < .001).
report(t.test(iris$Sepal.Width, iris$Sepal.Length, var.equal = TRUE))
#> The Two Sample t-test suggests that the difference between iris$Sepal.Width and iris$Sepal.Length (mean of x = 3.06, mean of y = 5.84, difference = -2.79) is significant (t(298) = -36.46, 95% CI [-2.94, -2.64], p < .001).
report(t.test(mtcars$mpg ~ mtcars$vs))
#> The Welch Two Sample t-test suggests that the difference of mtcars$mpg by mtcars$vs (mean in group 0 = 16.62, mean in group 1 = 24.56, difference = -7.94) is significant (t(22.72) = -4.67, 95% CI [-11.46, -4.42], p < .001).
report(t.test(iris$Sepal.Width, mu = 1))
#> The One Sample t-test suggests that the difference between iris$Sepal.Width (mean = 3.06) and mu = 1 is significant (t(149) = 57.81, 95% CI [2.99, 3.13], p < .001).
